newsitem.title: USA: INCSTAR holders approve proposed merger.
newsitem.headline: INCSTAR holders approve proposed merger.

text.p: INCSTAR Corp said Thursday its shareholders have approved a proposed merger with an indirect subsidiary of American Standard Inc.
American Standard Inc is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Standard Companies Inc, a diversified manufacturer.

INCSTAR develops, produces and markets diagnostic tests. As a result of the merger, holders of INCSTAR common stock are entitled to receive $6.32 in cash, without interest, for each outstanding share of common stock and INCSTAR.
Closing of the merger requires completion by American Standard Inc of its agreement to acquire the European medical diagnostic business of Sorin Biomedica S.p.A..

Sorin Biomedica, which owns 52 percent of INCSTAR, is a medical technology company with businesses focused on the diagnostic, cardiovascular and hemodialysis segments of the international healthcare market.
INCSTAR common shares, which are traded in the Nasdaq National Market, are expected to cease trading at the close of the markets on June 27, 1997.
Assuming the satisfaction or waiver of all conditions, the merger is scheduled to close on Monday, June 30, 1997.
